00034 template<typename ForwardIterator, typename T, typename CMP> bool
00035 continousFind( ForwardIterator &current, const ForwardIterator end, const T &compare, CMP compOp )
00036 {
00037     //find the first iterator which is does not compare less
00038     current = std::lower_bound( current, end, compare, compOp );
00039 
00040     if ( current == end //if we're at the end
00041          || compOp( compare, *current ) //or compare is less than that iterator
00042        )
00043         return false;//we didn't find a match
00044     else
00045         return true;//not(current <> compare) makes compare == current
00046 }
00047 }
00048 const PropertyMap::mapped_type PropertyMap::emptyEntry;//dummy to be able to return an empty Property

00067 // The core tree traversal functions
00069 PropertyMap::mapped_type &PropertyMap::fetchEntry( const key_type &key )
00070 {
00071     const propPath path = util::stringToList<key_type>( key, pathSeperator );
00072     return fetchEntry( *this, path.begin(), path.end() );
00073 }
00078 PropertyMap::mapped_type &PropertyMap::fetchEntry(
00079     PropertyMap &root,
00080     const isis::util::PropertyMap::propPathIterator at, const isis::util::PropertyMap::propPathIterator pathEnd )
00081 {
00082     propPath::const_iterator next = at;
00083     next++;
00084     Container &rootRef = root;
00085     iterator found = static_cast<Container &>( root ).find( *at );
00086 
00087     if ( next != pathEnd ) {//we are not at the end of the path (a proposed leaf in the PropMap)
00088         if ( found != root.end() ) {//and we found the entry
00089             mapped_type &ref = found->second;
00090             LOG_IF( ref.is_leaf(), Runtime, error )
00091                     << util::MSubject( found->first ) << " is a leaf, but was requested as a branch in "
00092                     << util::MSubject( util::listToString( at, pathEnd, "/" ) );
00093             return fetchEntry( ref.getBranch(), next, pathEnd ); //continue there
00094         } else { // if we should create a sub-map
00095             //insert a empty branch (aka PropMap) at "*at" (and fetch the reference of that)
00096             LOG( Debug, verbose_info ) << "Creating an empty branch " << *at << " trough fetching";
00097             return fetchEntry( rootRef[*at].getBranch(), next, pathEnd ); // and continue there
00098         }
00099     } else { //if its the leaf
00100         LOG_IF( rootRef.find( *at ) == rootRef.end() , Debug, verbose_info ) << "Creating an empty entry " << *at << " trough fetching";
00101         return rootRef[*at]; // (create and) return that entry
00102     }
00103 }
00104 
00109 const PropertyMap::mapped_type *PropertyMap::findEntry(
00110     const PropertyMap &root,
00111     const propPathIterator at, const propPathIterator pathEnd )
00112 {
00113     propPathIterator next = at;
00114     next++;
00115     util::PropertyMap::const_iterator found = static_cast<const Container &>( root ).find( *at );
00116 
00117     if ( next != pathEnd ) {//we are not at the end of the path (aka the leaf)
00118         if ( found != root.end() ) {//and we found the entry
00119             const mapped_type &ref = found->second;
00120             return findEntry( ref.getBranch(), next, pathEnd ); //continue there
00121         }
00122     } else if ( found != root.end() ) {// if its the leaf and we found the entry
00123         return &found->second; // return that entry
00124     }
00125 
00126     return NULL;
00127 }
00128 bool PropertyMap::recursiveRemove( PropertyMap &root, const propPathIterator path_it, const propPathIterator pathEnd )
00129 {
00130     bool ret = false;
00131 
00132     if ( path_it != pathEnd ) {
00133         propPathIterator next = path_it;
00134         next++;
00135         iterator found = static_cast<Container &>( root ).find( *path_it );
00136 
00137         if ( found != root.end() ) {
00138             mapped_type &ref = found->second;
00139 
00140             if ( ! ref.is_leaf() ) {
00141                 ret = recursiveRemove( ref.getBranch(), next, pathEnd );
00142 
00143                 if ( ref.getBranch().isEmpty() )
00144                     root.erase( found ); // remove the now empty branch
00145             } else {
00146                 root.erase( found );
00147                 ret = true;
00148             }
00149         } else {
00150             LOG( Runtime, warning ) << "Entry " << util::MSubject( *path_it ) << " not found, skipping it";
00151         }
00152     }
00153 
00154     return ret;
00155 }

00159 // Generic interface for accessing elements

00162 const std::vector< PropertyValue >& PropertyMap::propertyValueVec( const PropertyMap::KeyType &key ) const
00163 {
00164     const propPath path = util::stringToList<key_type>( key, pathSeperator );
00165     const mapped_type *ref = findEntry( *this, path.begin(), path.end() );
00166 
00167     if( ref && ref->is_leaf() ) {
00168         return ref->getLeaf();
00169     } else {
00170         LOG( Debug, warning ) << "Property " << key << " not found. Returning empty property.";
00171         return emptyEntry.getLeaf();
00172     }
00173 }
00174 
00175 std::vector< PropertyValue >& PropertyMap::propertyValueVec( const PropertyMap::KeyType &key )
00176 {
00177     const propPath path = util::stringToList<key_type>( key, pathSeperator );
00178     mapped_type &n = fetchEntry( *this, path.begin(), path.end() );
00179     LOG_IF( ! n.is_leaf(), Debug, error ) << "Using branch " << key << " as PropertyValue";
00180     return n.getLeaf();
00181 }

00184 const PropertyValue &PropertyMap::propertyValue( const key_type &key )const
00185 {
00186     return propertyValueVec( key )[0];
00187 }
00188 
00189 PropertyValue &PropertyMap::propertyValue( const key_type &key )
00190 {
00191     propertyValueVec( key ).resize(1);// the user is expecting only one entry, so remove the others 
00192     return propertyValueVec( key )[0];
00193 }
00194 
00195 const PropertyMap &PropertyMap::branch( const key_type &key ) const
00196 {
00197     const propPath path = util::stringToList<key_type>( key, pathSeperator );
00198     const mapped_type *ref = findEntry( *this, path.begin(), path.end() );
00199 
00200     if( ! ref ) {
00201         LOG( Runtime, warning ) << "Trying to access non existing branch " << key << ".";
00202         return emptyEntry.getBranch();
00203     } else {
00204         LOG_IF( ref->getBranch().isEmpty(), Runtime, warning ) << "Accessing empty branch " << key;
00205         return ref->getBranch();
00206     }
00207 }
00208 PropertyMap &PropertyMap::branch( const key_type &key )
00209 {
00210     const propPath path = util::stringToList<key_type>( key, pathSeperator );
00211     mapped_type &n = fetchEntry( *this, path.begin(), path.end() );
00212     return n.getBranch();
00213 }
00214 
00215 bool PropertyMap::remove( const key_type &key )
00216 {
00217     const propPath path = util::stringToList<key_type>( key, pathSeperator );
00218     return recursiveRemove( *this, path.begin(), path.end() );
00219 }
00220 
00221 bool PropertyMap::remove(const KeyList& removeList, bool keep_needed)
00222 {
00223     bool ret=true;
00224     BOOST_FOREACH(const KeyType &key,removeList){ 
00225         if(hasProperty(key)){// remove everything which is there
00226             if(!(propertyValue(key).isNeeded() && keep_needed)){ // if its not needed or keep_need is not true
00227                 ret &= remove(key);
00228             }
00229         }
00230     }
00231     return ret;
00232 }
00233 
00234 
00235 bool PropertyMap::remove( const isis::util::PropertyMap &removeMap, bool keep_needed )
00236 {
00237     iterator thisIt = begin();
00238     bool ret = true;
00239 
00240     //remove everything that is also in second
00241     for ( const_iterator otherIt = removeMap.begin(); otherIt != removeMap.end(); otherIt++ ) {
00242         //find the closest match for otherIt->first in this (use the value-comparison-functor of PropMap)
00243         if ( continousFind( thisIt, end(), *otherIt, value_comp() ) ) { //thisIt->first == otherIt->first - so its the same property or propmap
00244             if ( ! thisIt->second.is_leaf() ) { //this is a branch
00245                 if ( ! otherIt->second.is_leaf() ) { // recurse if its a branch in the removal map as well
00246                     PropertyMap &mySub = thisIt->second.getBranch();
00247                     const PropertyMap &otherSub = otherIt->second.getBranch();
00248                     ret &= mySub.remove( otherSub );
00249 
00250                     if( mySub.isEmpty() ) // delete my branch, if its empty
00251                         erase( thisIt++ );
00252                 } else {
00253                     LOG( Debug, warning ) << "Not deleting branch " << MSubject( thisIt->first ) << " because its no subtree in the removal map";
00254                     ret = false;
00255                 }
00256             } else if( !( thisIt->second.getLeaf()[0].isNeeded() && keep_needed ) ) { // this is a leaf
00257                 erase( thisIt++ ); // so delete this (they are equal - kind of)
00258             }
00259         }
00260     }
00261 
00262     return ret;
00263 }

00267 // utilities
00269 bool PropertyMap::isValid() const
00270 {
00271     //iterate through the whole map and return false as soon as we find something needed _and_ empty
00272     const const_iterator found = std::find_if( begin(), end(), treeInvalidP() );
00273     return found == end();
00274 }

00276 bool PropertyMap::isEmpty() const
00277 {
00278     return Container::empty();

00281 PropertyMap::DiffMap PropertyMap::getDifference( const PropertyMap &other ) const
00282 {
00283     PropertyMap::DiffMap ret;
00284     diffTree( other, ret, "" );
00285     return ret;
00286 }
00287 
00288 void PropertyMap::diffTree( const PropertyMap &other, PropertyMap::DiffMap &ret, istring prefix ) const
00289 {
00290     const_iterator otherIt = other.begin();
00291 
00292     //insert everything that is in this, but not in second or is on both but differs
00293     for ( const_iterator thisIt = begin(); thisIt != end(); thisIt++ ) {
00294         const propPath::value_type pathname = prefix + thisIt->first;
00295 
00296         //find the closest match for thisIt->first in other (use the value-comparison-functor of PropMap)
00297         if ( _internal::continousFind( otherIt, other.end(), *thisIt, value_comp() ) ) { //otherIt->first == thisIt->first - so its the same property
00298             const mapped_type &first = thisIt->second, &second = otherIt->second;
00299 
00300             if ( ! ( first.is_leaf() || second.is_leaf() ) ) { // if both are a branch
00301                 const PropertyMap &thisMap = first.getBranch();
00302                 const PropertyMap &refMap = second.getBranch();
00303                 thisMap.diffTree( refMap, ret, pathname + "/" );
00304             } else if ( ! ( first == second )  ) { // if they are not equal
00305                 const PropertyValue firstVal = first.is_leaf() ? first.getLeaf()[0] : PropertyValue( Value<std::string>( first.toString() ) );
00306                 const PropertyValue secondVal = second.is_leaf() ? second.getLeaf()[0] : PropertyValue( Value<std::string>( second.toString() ) );
00307                 ret.insert( // add (propertyname|(value1|value2))
00308                     ret.end(),      // we know it has to be at the end
00309                     std::make_pair(
00310                         pathname,   //the key
00311                         std::make_pair( firstVal, secondVal ) //pair of both values
00312                     )
00313                 );
00314             }
00315         } else { // if ref is not in the other map
00316             const PropertyValue firstVal = thisIt->second.is_leaf() ? thisIt->second.getLeaf()[0] : PropertyValue( Value<std::string>( thisIt->second.toString() ) );
00317             ret.insert( // add (propertyname|(value1|[empty]))
00318                 ret.end(),      // we know it has to be at the end
00319                 std::make_pair(
00320                     pathname,
00321                     std::make_pair( firstVal, PropertyValue() )
00322                 )
00323             );
00324         }
00325     }
00326 
00327     //insert everything that is in second but not in this
00328     const_iterator thisIt = begin();
00329 
00330     for ( otherIt = other.begin(); otherIt != other.end(); otherIt++ ) {
00331         const propPath::value_type pathname = prefix + otherIt->first;
00332 
00333         if ( ! _internal::continousFind( thisIt, end(), *otherIt, value_comp() ) ) { //there is nothing in this which has the same key as ref
00334             const PropertyValue secondVal = otherIt->second.is_leaf() ? otherIt->second.getLeaf()[0] : PropertyValue( Value<std::string>( otherIt->second.toString() ) );
00335             ret.insert(
00336                 std::make_pair( // add (propertyname|([empty]|value2))
00337                     pathname,
00338                     std::make_pair( PropertyValue(), secondVal )
00339                 )
00340             );
00341         }
00342     }
00343 }
00344 
00345 void PropertyMap::removeEqual ( const util::PropertyMap &other, bool removeNeeded )
00346 {
00347     iterator thisIt = begin();
00348 
00349     //remove everything that is also in second and equal (or also empty)
00350     for ( const_iterator otherIt = other.begin(); otherIt != other.end(); otherIt++ ) {
00351         //find the closest match for otherIt->first in this (use the value-comparison-functor of PropMap)
00352         if ( continousFind( thisIt, end(), *otherIt, value_comp() ) ) { //thisIt->first == otherIt->first  - so its the same property
00353             if ( ! removeNeeded && thisIt->second.getLeaf()[0].isNeeded() ) {//Skip needed
00354                 thisIt++;
00355                 continue;
00356             }
00357 
00358             if ( thisIt->second.empty() ) { //this is empty
00359                 if ( otherIt->second.empty() ) { //the other is empty
00360                     erase( thisIt++ ); // so delete this (they are equal - kind of)
00361                 } else {
00362                     LOG( Debug, verbose_info ) << "Keeping the empty " << thisIt->first << " because its is not empty in the other (" << *otherIt << ")";
00363                     thisIt++;
00364                 }
00365             } else if ( ! otherIt->second.empty() ) { // if the other is not empty as well
00366                 if ( thisIt->second == otherIt->second ) { //delete this, if they are equal
00367                     LOG( Debug, verbose_info ) << "Removing " << *thisIt << " because its equal with the other (" << *otherIt << ")";
00368                     erase( thisIt++ ); // so delete this (they are equal - kind of)
00369                 } else if ( ! ( thisIt->second.is_leaf() || otherIt->second.is_leaf() ) ) { //but maybe they are branches
00370                     PropertyMap &thisMap = thisIt->second.getBranch();
00371                     const PropertyMap &otherMap = otherIt->second.getBranch();
00372                     thisMap.removeEqual( otherMap );
00373                     thisIt++;
00374                 }
00375             } else {//only the other is empty
00376                 LOG( Debug, verbose_info ) << "Keeping " << *thisIt << " because the other is empty";
00377                 thisIt++;
00378             }
00379         }
00380     }
00381 }

00383 
00384 PropertyMap::KeyList PropertyMap::join( const isis::util::PropertyMap &other, bool overwrite )
00385 {
00386     KeyList rejects;
00387     joinTree( other, overwrite, "", rejects );
00388     return rejects;
00389 }
00390 
00391 void PropertyMap::joinTree( const isis::util::PropertyMap &other, bool overwrite, util::istring prefix, PropertyMap::KeyList &rejects )
00392 {
00393     iterator thisIt = begin();
00394 
00395     for ( const_iterator otherIt = other.begin(); otherIt != other.end(); otherIt++ ) { //iterate through the elements of other
00396         if ( continousFind( thisIt, end(), *otherIt, value_comp() ) ) { // if the element is allready here
00397             if ( thisIt->second.empty() ) { // if ours is empty
00398                 LOG( Debug, verbose_info ) << "Replacing empty property " << MSubject( thisIt->first ) << " by " << MSubject( otherIt->second );
00399                 thisIt->second = otherIt->second;
00400             } else if ( ! ( thisIt->second.is_leaf() || otherIt->second.is_leaf() ) ) { // if both are a subtree
00401                 PropertyMap &thisMap = thisIt->second.getBranch();
00402                 const PropertyMap &refMap = otherIt->second.getBranch();
00403                 thisMap.joinTree( refMap, overwrite, prefix + thisIt->first + "/", rejects ); //recursion
00404             } else if ( overwrite ) { // otherwise replace ours by the other (if we shall overwrite)
00405                 LOG( Debug, info ) << "Replacing property " << MSubject( *thisIt ) << " by " << MSubject( otherIt->second );
00406                 thisIt->second = otherIt->second;
00407             } else if ( ! ( thisIt->second == otherIt->second ) ) { // otherwise put the other into rejected if its not equal to our
00408                 LOG( Debug, info )
00409                         << "Rejecting property " << MSubject( *otherIt )
00410                         << " because " << MSubject( thisIt->second ) << " is allready there";
00411                 rejects.insert( rejects.end(), prefix + otherIt->first );
00412             }
00413         } else { // ok we dont have that - just insert it
00414             std::pair<const_iterator, bool> inserted = insert( *otherIt );
00415             LOG_IF( inserted.second, Debug, verbose_info ) << "Inserted property " << MSubject( *inserted.first ) << ".";
00416         }
00417     }
00418 }

00421 void PropertyMap::makeFlatMap( FlatMap &out, key_type key_prefix ) const
00422 {
00423     for ( const_iterator i = begin(); i != end(); i++ ) {
00424         key_type key = ( key_prefix.empty() ? "" : key_prefix + pathSeperator ) + i->first;
00425 
00426         if ( i->second.is_leaf()  ) {
00427             out.insert( std::make_pair( key, i->second.getLeaf()[0] ) );
00428         } else {
00429             i->second.getBranch().makeFlatMap( out, key );
00430         }
00431     }
00432 }
00433 
00434 PropertyMap::FlatMap PropertyMap::getFlatMap() const
00435 {
00436     isis::util::PropertyMap::FlatMap buff;
00437     makeFlatMap( buff );
00438     return buff;
00439 }

00441 
00442 bool PropertyMap::transform( key_type from,  key_type to, int dstID, bool delSource )
00443 {
00444     const PropertyValue &found = propertyValue( from );
00445     bool ret = false;
00446 
00447     if( ! found.isEmpty() ) {
00448         util::ValueReference &dst = static_cast<util::ValueReference &>( propertyValue( to ) );
00449 
00450         if ( found->getTypeID() == dstID ) {
00451             if( from != to ) {
00452                 dst = found ;
00453                 ret = true;
00454             } else {
00455                 LOG( Debug, info ) << "Not transforming " << MSubject( found ) << " into same type at same place.";
00456             }
00457         } else {
00458             LOG_IF( from == to, Debug, warning ) << "Transforming " << MSubject( found ) << " in place.";
00459             dst = found->copyByID( dstID );
00460             ret = !dst.isEmpty();
00461         }
00462     }
00463 
00464     if ( ret && delSource )remove( from );
00465 
00466     return ret;
00467 }

00499 void PropertyMap::addNeededFromString( const std::string &needed )
00500 {
00501     const std::list<std::string> needList = util::stringToList<std::string>( needed );
00502     //@todo util::stringToList<std::string>( needed,' ' ) would be faster but less robust
00503     LOG( Debug, verbose_info ) << "Adding " << needed << " as needed";
00504     BOOST_FOREACH( std::list<std::string>::const_reference ref, needList ) {
00505         addNeeded( key_type( ref.c_str() ) );

00508 
00509 bool PropertyMap::hasProperty( const key_type &key ) const
00510 {
00511     const propPath path = util::stringToList<key_type>( key, pathSeperator );
00512     const mapped_type *ref = findEntry( *this, path.begin(), path.end() );
00513     return ( ref && ref->is_leaf() && ! ref->getLeaf()[0].isEmpty() );
00514 }
00515 
00516 isis::util::PropertyMap::KeyType PropertyMap::find( isis::util::PropertyMap::KeyType key, bool allowProperty, bool allowBranch ) const
00517 {
00518     // make sure we only get the last part of the path if its one
00519     const propPath path = util::stringToList<key_type>( key, pathSeperator );
00520 
00521     if( path.empty() ) {
00522         LOG( Debug, error ) << "Search key " << util::MSubject( key ) << " is invalid, won't search";
00523         return KeyType();
00524     } else if( path.size() > 1 ) {
00525         LOG( Debug, warning ) << "Stripping search key " << util::MSubject( key ) << " to " << path.back();
00526     }
00527 
00528     key = path.back();
00529 
00530     // if the searched key is on this brach return its name
00531     const Container &map = static_cast<const Container &>( *this );
00532     Container::const_iterator found = map.find( key );
00533 
00534     if( found != map.end() &&
00535         ( ( found->second.is_leaf() && allowProperty ) || ( !found->second.is_leaf() && allowBranch ) )
00536       ) {
00537         return found->first;
00538     } else { // otherwise search in the branches (getBranch() returns an empty PropMap for leaves - we wont have to check for that)
00539         BOOST_FOREACH( Container::const_reference ref, map ) {
00540             const KeyType foundKey = ref.second.getBranch().find( key, allowProperty, allowBranch );
00541 
00542             if( !foundKey.empty() ) // if the key is found abort search and return it with its branch-name
00543                 return ref.first + "/" + foundKey;
00544         }
00545     }
00546 
00547     return KeyType(); // nothing found
00548 }
00549 
00550 bool PropertyMap::hasBranch( const key_type &key ) const
00551 {
00552     const propPath path = util::stringToList<key_type>( key, pathSeperator );
00553     const mapped_type *ref = findEntry( *this, path.begin(), path.end() );
00554     return ( ref && ! ref->is_leaf()  );
00555 }
00556 
00557 bool PropertyMap::rename( key_type oldname, key_type newname )
00558 {
00559     const mapped_type *old_e = findEntry( oldname );
00560     const mapped_type *new_e = findEntry( newname );
00561 
00562     if ( old_e ) {
00563         LOG_IF( new_e && ! new_e->empty(), Runtime, warning )
00564                 << "Overwriting " << std::make_pair( newname, *new_e ) << " with " << *old_e;
00565         fetchEntry( newname ) = *old_e;
00566         return remove( oldname );
00567     } else {
00568         LOG( Runtime, warning )
00569                 << "Cannot rename " << oldname << " it does not exist";
00570         return false;
00571     }
00572 }
00573 
00574 void PropertyMap::toCommonUnique( PropertyMap &common, std::set<key_type> &uniques, bool init )const
00575 {
00576     if ( init ) {
00577         common = *this;
00578         uniques.clear();
00579         return;
00580     } else {
00581         const DiffMap difference = common.getDifference( *this );
00582         BOOST_FOREACH( const DiffMap::value_type & ref, difference ) {
00583             uniques.insert( ref.first );
00584 
00585             if ( ! ref.second.first.isEmpty() )common.remove( ref.first );//if there is something in common, remove it
00586         }
00587     }
00588 }
00589 
00590 std::ostream &PropertyMap::print( std::ostream &out, bool label )const
00591 {
00592     FlatMap buff;
00593     makeFlatMap( buff );
00594     size_t key_len = 0;
00595 
00596     for ( FlatMap::const_iterator i = buff.begin(); i != buff.end(); i++ )
00597         if ( key_len < i->first.length() )
00598             key_len = i->first.length();
00599 
00600     for ( FlatMap::const_iterator i = buff.begin(); i != buff.end(); i++ )
00601         out << i->first << std::string( key_len - i->first.length(), ' ' ) + ":" << i->second.toString( label ) << std::endl;
00602 
00603     return out;
00604 }
00605 
00606 const PropertyMap::mapped_type *PropertyMap::findEntry( const key_type &key )const
00607 {
00608     const propPath path = util::stringToList<key_type>( key, pathSeperator );
00609     return findEntry( *this, path.begin(), path.end() );
00610 }
00611 
00612 
00613 bool PropertyMap::listP::operator()(const std::pair< const isis::util::istring, _internal::treeNode >& ref) const
00614 {
00615     return ref.second.is_leaf() && ref.second.getLeaf().size()>1;
00616 }
00617 
00618 bool PropertyMap::trueP::operator()( const PropertyMap::value_type &/*ref*/ ) const
00619 {
00620     return true;
00621 }
00622 bool PropertyMap::invalidP::operator()( const PropertyMap::value_type &ref ) const
00623 {
00624     return ref.second.getLeaf()[0].isNeeded() && ref.second.getLeaf()[0].isEmpty();
00625 }
00626 bool PropertyMap::treeInvalidP::operator()( const PropertyMap::value_type &ref ) const
00627 {
00628     if ( ref.second.is_leaf() ) {
00629         const PropertyValue &val = ref.second.getLeaf()[0];
00630         return val.isNeeded() && val.isEmpty();
00631     } else  {
00632         return ! ref.second.getBranch().isValid();
00633     }
00634 }
00635 
00636 }
00637 }
